bibl.title: Letter from F.A. McKenna to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1941

div1.p: McKenna lists room prices at the Hotel Nacional de Cuba, in Havana.

div1.head: Letter from F.A. McKenna to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1941
div1.opener:
HOTEL
NACIONAL
DE CUBA
HABANA
CABLE-NACL HOTEL
March, 24th, 1941.
AIR MAIL. Dr. P. S. Hench,
Villa Atlantique Hotel,
Palm Beach, Fla.
Room 353
single 660
on city (not
ocean) side
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
We thank you for your letter of March 18th and
wish to advise that the room you occupied on your last visit, ac-
companied by Mrs. Hench was No. 711.

The rate on this room is $13.00 when occupied by
one person, daily, European Plan, until the 31st of March, inclu-
sive. From April 1st on, the rate will be $8.00 daily, European
Plan, when occupied by one person.

We have other single rooms from $6.00 daily, Eu-
ropean Plan, until March 31st, inclusive, and from April 1st, from
$3.00 daily, European Plan.

All rates are quoted and are payable in U. S. Cur-
rency or its Cuban equivalent.
Looking forward to having you with us again, we are,
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, HOTEL NACIONAL DE CUBA,
F. A. McKenna,
Manager. FMK:G
